p.k: The border crossing into Chile happens in record time and the team is set to visit the European Southern observatory in the middle of the Atacama desert, one of the driest places on Earth. It's a very inspiring moment to connect with other engineers at the frontline of technology and reflect on their latest findings about the universe. There is another racing competition in Santiago and after 64 driving days the team finally reaches Argentina, the 14th country. But on the way to Ushuaia, the most Southern city in the world they still have to cover over 1500km and are facing plenty of surprises.
